TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DynamicDocumentPaginator extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator
Public MustInherit Class DynamicDocumentPaginator Inherits DocumentPaginator

summary.span: 提供抽象基类，该抽象基类除了支持其自己基类的方法和属性之外，还支持自动后台分页和在重新分页期间跟踪内容位置。

span.span: Provides an abstract base class that supports automatic background pagination and tracking content positions across repaginations in addition to the methods and properties of its own base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下， 将在后台自动将内容预分页 (此过程在 " 是" 时开始 `true` ，这是默认设置) 。By default, a will automatically pre-paginate content in the background (this process begins when is `true`, which is the default setting). 当 为时 `true` ，布局也将书籍，因为中的内容或更改发生更改 。When is `true`, the layout will also be repaginated due to changes in content or changes in . 此 事件发生在一个或多个页 (或重新分页) 的情况下，如以下情况中所示：The event occurs upon completion of pagination (or repagination) of one or more pages, such as in the following situations: - 在后台对内容进行分页时，将发生事件。 events occur as content is paginated in the background. 根据实现，该事件可能发生在分页一页或多页 ( 指定哪些页已分页) 。Depending on the implementation, the event may occur upon paginating one or multiple pages ( specifies which pages have been paginated). - 如果指定的页尚未分页，则对或的调用可能会导致 事件发生。Calls to or may cause an event to occur if the page specified has not been paginated. 例如，如果 () 启用了后台分页 = `true` ，但分页只是在第三页完成，则 使用参数6的调用将导致对页4、5、6和7进行分页。For example, if background pagination is enabled ( = `true`) but pagination has only been completed up to the third page, a call of with an argument of 6 will cause pages four, five, six, and seven to be paginated. 完成后， 将引发一个事件，其 设置为 = 4， = 4。Upon completion, a event will be raised with settings of = 4 and = 4. - 启用后台分页后 ( = `true`) ， 对流格式内容的更改（如 ）可能会导致重新分页和关联的 事件。With background pagination enabled ( = `true`), a change in on flow-format content, such as a , may cause repagination and associated events. 请注意，对 固定格式的内容（如）不会有任何影响，在这种 情况下，可视页面大小不会影响布局。Note that has no effect in repagination on fixed-format content, such as , where the visual page size does not affect the layout. 禁用后台分页时也会发生事件。A event also occurs when background pagination is disabled. 例如，如果一页内容和 = `false`) ，则 使用参数0调用将产生两个事件：For example, if there is only one page of content and = `false`), calling with an argument of 0 will result in two events: 1. 设置为 = 0 且 = 1 的事件。A event with settings of = 0 and = 1. 2. 事件。A event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果上的页面尚未 `contentPosition` 设置格式，则在返回请求的页码之前，它们将同步分页。If pages prior to the `contentPosition` have not been formatted, they will be paginated synchronously prior to returning the requested page number. 提供类似于的功能 ，但具有异步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but with asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 取消此方法的异步操作的唯一方法是取消所有异步操作。The only way to cancel the asynchronous operation of this method is to cancel all asynchronous operations. 与此方法的其他重载相比： 。Contrast this with the other overload of this method: . 此方法引发 事件。This method raises the event. 页码作为事件参数之一传递到事件。The page number is passed to the event as one of the event arguments. 有关如何使用此方法获取页码的详细说明，请参阅。See for how to use this method to get the page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重载可以取消此异步操作，而无需取消所有异步操作。This overload of the method makes it possible to cancel this asynchronous operation without cancelling all asynchronous operations. 此方法引发 事件。This method raises the event. 以下步骤演示了如何以异步方式检索给定的页码 `contentPosition` 。The following steps illustrate how to retrieve the page number of a given `contentPosition` asynchronously. 1. 创建一个 委托，并将其添加为事件的通知 。Create a delegate and add it to be notified of events. 2. 调用 指定所 `contentPosition` 需的和 `userState` 将用于标识异步任务的唯一对象。Call specifying the `contentPosition` desired and a unique `userState` object that will be used to identify the asynchronous task. 3. 当发生事件并且调用委托时，将比较事件的 。When the event occurs and the delegate is called, compare the event's . 具有原始参数的属性 `userState` 。property with the original `userState` parameter. 4. 如果为 。When the . 属性与原始属性匹配 `userState` ，操作完成并且页码已准备就绪。property matches the original `userState`, the operation is complete and the page number is ready. ( 。(The . 属性还将与原始 `contentPosition` 参数匹配。 ) property will also match the original `contentPosition` parameter.) 5. .The . 属性包含指定的从零开始的页码 `contentPosition` 。property contains the zero-based page number of the specified `contentPosition`. 提供类似于的功能 ，但用于同步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but for synchronous operation.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否在后台自动执行分页，以响应某些事件（如页大小的更改）。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pagination is performed automatically in the background in response to certain events, such as a change in page size.

value.span: 如果已启用后台分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if background pagination is enabled; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果为 `true` ，则在后台执行分页， 并相应地引发和 事件。When `true`, pagination is performed in the background, raising and events as appropriate. 与不同的是，内容的分页 不会受对视觉对象的更改的影响 。Pagination of content, as distinct from a is not affected by changes to the visual .
